title: Haleakalā National Park: Entomological Collection
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections     Entomological Collection                 Entomological Collection           The Entomology Collection of Haleakalā National Park includes the following insect specimens that can be found within park boundaries and the Island of Maui.       Threatened and Endangered InsectsUnder the Endangered Species Act of 1973, "Threatened Species" is defined as any species which is likely to become an endangered species within the foreseeable future throughout all or a significant portion of its range, while "Endangered Species" is defined as any species which is in danger of extinction.Order Odonata       Native Insects These insects occur naturally with respect to a particular ecosystem and can be either endemic (found only in Hawai'i) or indigenous (found in Hawai'i as well as other places).Order ColeopteraOrder DipteraOrder HemipteraOrder HymenopteraOrder LepidopteraOrder NeuropteraOrder Odonata
